sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Western governments race to rescue diplomats and citizens trapped in Sudan as the fighting in Khartoum continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Italian government says it's seeing a huge increase in the number of migrants risking their lives to cross the Mediterranean in small boats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Votes are being cast in four municipalities in northern Kosovo, but turnouts expect to be low with the main Serb party declaring a boycott.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Evacuations of foreign nationals caught in Sudan's deadly fighting are intensifying despite a promised ceasefire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The evacuations have been complicated by ongoing clashes. A French national was shot and injured by a sniper when an embassy convoy was attacked. UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak tweeted that British diplomats and their families have been evacuated in a complex and rapid British military operation. US President Joe Biden tweeted, on my orders, the United States military extracted US government personnel from Khartoum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As Saudi and foreign nationals evacuated from Sudan arrived in Jeddah, there were appeals for peace and prayers for anyone still caught up in the conflict. I call on everyone to stop violence as soon as possible, to take the road of dialogue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I invite everyone to pray for our brothers and sisters in Sudan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But on Sudan's lawless streets, scarred by more than a week of fighting, there was little sign of an end to the violent power struggle that has claimed hundreds of lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And for any foreign nationals remaining in the country dwindling hopes of rescue Sunday morning and a rescue ship arrives in the Italian port of Bari ocean Viking

sentences.sentence: They come from Bangladesh and Sudan. War is fueling the flow of migrants.

sentences.sentence: war is fueling the flow of migrants official Italian government migration figures comparing the first four months of the last three years show a dramatic increase in 2023 around the coast in the Calabrian port of Rochella Yonica Saturday evening saw new arrivals. 90 migrants who've been in a 20-metre sailing boat for four days. 2,000 migrants have arrived at this small port in 2023 alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Like this Bulgarian cereal farmer, many farmers in Eastern Europe have delayed selling their production while waiting for prices to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But with the approach of the harvest, time is running out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They have been demonstrating for several weeks to demand more control over Ukrainian grain exports, considered responsible for the fall in prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They denounced the ineffectiveness of the solidarity corridors, the tax-free transit routes for Ukrainian goods on roads, rails and in European ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Grain intended for the other markets and emerging countries, but which finally flooded the countries bordering Ukraine. Farmers say they support the transit of Ukrainian goods through Europe, but which finally flooded the countries bordering Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Farmers say they support the transit of Ukrainian goods through Europe, but not at the expense of their local economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It's no problem for us to transit all that production, but at the moment transit is not a real transit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It's stay here in Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In response to this protest, Bulgaria, Hungary and Slovakia have announced bans on Ukrainian grain imports until the end of June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They want to be able to control the amount of Ukrainian goods that enter their markets, for example with sealed containers or trucks.

sentences.sentence: An individual member state cannot unilaterally impose trade restrictions on a third party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the European Union, the competence to deal with trade policy and to adopt trade measures lies exclusively with the European Union and with the European Commission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: To appease the countries affected, the EU has offered to provide more than 150 million euros in emergency aid to farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Romania and Poland have now suspended the ban on the transit of Ukrainian grain, after the EU said any aid would be dependent on the withdrawal of restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian armed forces have been actively preparing at home and abroad for a big push.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: New units are being trained for a major counter-offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But big questions remain over where and when.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Some politicians and military experts predict a strike towards the Sea of Azov, potentially splitting occupied areas while cutting routes to Crimea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Others suggest targeting Russian flanks in Luhansk or Kherson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The recent leak of Pentagon documents showed Western experts expecting a push in late April, May or June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But that leak in itself may force a change of plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Russians now know how deep and with what means the American intelligence services can look into the Russian planning and Russian command and control structure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And they might adjust, for example, their codes or their encryption to prevent that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: If that happens, and if Western intelligence at the time of the counteroffensive is less precise than it used to be, that would be a bad thing for Ukrainians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russia's strengthening its defences along the entire 800-kilometre front line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Western experts doubt the Ukrainian counter-offensive will bring the war to an end this year, but the operation could prove decisive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: If they have achieved significant success, then I think they'll be in a position to force the Russians to the table and perhaps extract some kind of concessions, particularly if Crimea is threatened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But if the Ukrainians haven't achieved much success, then I think they'll be facing a lot more pressure from their allies, who are really at the limit, I think, now, or approaching the limit of what they're willing to give in terms of assistance and equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And so Ukraine will probably face a lot more pressure to find some kind of status quo ceasefire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Toledo, who ruled for five years from 2001, is accused of pocketing tens of millions of dollars worth of bribes from a Brazilian company.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He denies the charges and is set to stand trial.

sentences.sentence: An international field of 10,500 runners competed in the 36th Belgrade Marathon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Moroccan Lakhgar Chakib won the men's race in a time of 2 hours 14 and 28 seconds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ethiopia's Fain Gedeto Gemeda won the women's race in 2 hours 30 and 30 seconds. The second fastest time ever recorded in the race.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A 42 kilometer carnival of flowers has been snaking its way through the Dutch countryside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Colorful floats accompanied by brass bands made their way from Nordvek to Haarlem. About 1,500 volunteers take part, drawing crowds of up to a million people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The annual parade dates back to 1947. In 2021 the flower parade was added to a UNESCO list of intangible heritage.
